name: Vintage Radio
description: An old-fashioned radio with a crackling speaker and a large tuning dial. It occasionally picks up news broadcasts from... somewhere.
long_description: A beautifully weathered radio sitting on a wooden shelf. The brass dial gleams in the firelight, and static occasionally hisses from the speaker. It seems to be tuned to some kind of news station, though the signal comes and goes mysteriously. There's a sticky note on it that says 'Press button for news bulletin.'

- Multiple counts of Grand Theft Baguette

Witnesses report the fugitives were last seen wearing what appeared to be "a single long raincoat" and "a suspiciously large hat." When questioned, bystanders described the getaway as "more of a hurried waddle than a run" and noted "an unusual amount of feathers."

These waterfowl are considered:

- POORLY DISGUISED (but determined)

If you see anyone matching this description:
- Tall (approximately 6 feet when stacked)

Local bakeries report a 300% increase in suspicious waddling near their establishments. One baker described seeing "a very tall person who kept staring at the baguettes and making soft honking sounds."

When approached, the individual allegedly stated: "I'm just... looking. For a friend. Who definitely isn't me. I mean us. I mean THEM!"

Security footage shows what appears to be "two large birds poorly coordinating their movements inside human clothing."

Chief Quacksworth reminds citizens: "If it waddles like geese and honks like geese, it's probably geese. No matter how large the hat."
